Archive Node Size: Ethereum vs Solana vs Cardano

Here’s a fact well known among builders the archive node sizes of these three protocols are fascinatingly different.🧵

- Ethereum (Geth): 20+ TB (grows 1 TB/year)
- Solana: 400+ TB (grows 80 TB/year)
- Cardano: ~700 GB (grows 150 https://t.co/1oNjMWD4JP

why does an L1 zkEVM even matter?

today, ethereum validators re-run every transaction to verify blocks.
it works, but it’s expensive, slow, and limits scalability

zkEVM makes it better 
validators stop re-executing
they just verify tiny zk proofs that say “this block is valid” https://t.co/k9R2TJyazM
